perturbation.original_text: 1.3	“Affiliate”	means	any	distributor	or ranchisee	of	HSWI	or	any	company	or	other	entity	worldwide, including	without	limitation	corporations,	partnerships,	joint	ventures,	and	limited	liability	companies	in	which HSWI	directly	or	indirectly	holds	at	least	a	19%	ownership,	equity,	control	or	financial	interest	and	which	HSWI intends	to	enjoy	any	of	HSWI’s	rights	hereunder. A	list	of	Affiliates	as	of	the	Effective	Date	is	attached	hereto as	Attachment	A. Attachment	A	may	be	modified	from	time	to	time	upon	notice	by	HSWI	to	reflect	a	revised list	of	Affiliates	and	each	modified	Attachment	A	shall	be	deemed	in corporated	herein	by	reference.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.3	“Affiliate”	means	any	distributor	or ranchisee	of	HSWI	or	any	company	or	other	entity	worldwide, including	without	limitation	corporations,	partnerships,	joint	ventures,	and	limited	liability	companies	in	which HSWI	directly	or	indirectly	holds	at	least	a	5%	ownership,	equity,	control	or	financial	interest	and	which	HSWI intends	to	enjoy	any	of	HSWI’s	rights	hereunder. A	list	of	Affiliates	as	of	the	Effective	Date	is	attached	hereto as	Attachment	A. Attachment	A	may	be	modified	from	time	to	time	upon	notice	by	HSWI	to	reflect	a	revised list	of	Affiliates	and	each	modified	Attachment	A	shall	be	deemed	in corporated	herein	by	reference.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Affiliate' is changed from 19% to 5% ownership. This creates a conflict because the legal definition of 'affiliate' for regulatory purposes may vary. Using a lower percentage contradicts typical control thresholds, potentially misrepresenting the extent of HSWI's influence over these entities and affecting compliance with securities or antitrust regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Antitrust Laws

perturbation.original_text: 1.16	“Exclusive”	shall	mean	World	Book	shall	have	no	further	right	to	grant	to	third	parties	the	same	or any	other	licenses	to	the	Content	in	the	Open	Free	Web	and	itself	retains	no	such	rights	or	other	licenses.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.16	“Exclusive”	shall	mean	World	Book	shall	have	no	further	right	to	grant	to	third	parties	the	same	or any	other	licenses	to	the	Content	in	the	Open	Free	Web	and	itself	may	retains	such	rights	or	other	licenses.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Exclusive' is altered by changing 'retains no such rights' to 'may retain such rights'. This creates a direct contradiction within the contract. The term 'exclusive' legally implies that the licensor gives up all rights to the specified content within the defined scope. Allowing the licensor to retain rights undermines the exclusivity and could lead to disputes about the scope of the licensee's rights, particularly under copyright law.

perturbation.original_text: 11.11	Independent	Contractors. Notwithstanding	any	provision	h ereof,	for	purposes	of	this	Agreement, each	party	shall	be	and	act	as	an	independent	contractor	and	not	as	a	partner,	a	joint	venturer,	or	an	agent	of the	other	party,	and	shall	not	bind	nor	attempt	to	bind	the	other	party	in	any	way	without	prior	written	consent.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.11	Independent	Contractors. Notwithstanding	any	provision	h ereof,	for	purposes	of	this	Agreement, each	party	shall	be	and	act	as	an	contractor	and	not	as	a	partner,	a	joint	venturer,	or	an	agent	of the	other	party,	and	shall	not	bind	nor	attempt	to	bind	the	other	party	in	any	way	without	prior	written	consent.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'independent contractor' is shortened to 'contractor' in Section 11.11. This introduces ambiguity because 'contractor' is a broader term that does not necessarily imply the same level of autonomy and lack of control as 'independent contractor.' This could lead to misinterpretations regarding liability for taxes, workers' compensation, and other legal obligations under state and federal labor laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA), IRS guidelines for independent contractor classification
